channel.title: RuneScape's server game engine
channel.description:
What does everyone know about it? I would like to compile some documentation about it.
Here are a few things I know:
[ul][li]Loops every 600 milliseconds (not sure if they still do this..)[/li] [li]There is an 'instance system' (ei: how cut scenes do not show other players, and other players cannot see you during a cut scene)[/li] [li]Script support since 2001 for game content[/li][/ul]
Can anyone else pitch facts about it, and I'll add it to the list! Thanks!

item.title: RuneScape's server game engine
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“amfg, post:22, topic:442833”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=545518.msg3999109#msg3999109 date=1337711575]
It was 204 until they reopened rsc and the latest one is 233.
[/quote]

They probably used the 193 number because Krichevskoy released a client from the RS2 beta that was version 194. The last RSC release before RS2 became the main game was around 196-199 iirc.

My memory is hazy but I’m sure I remember Kaitnieks releasing a 198 RSC deob when RS2 was out.[/quote]

I think they were still dishing out client releases for RSC during the RS2 beta. RSC did stop in the 2xx range, and RS2 did start in 194. Also, let’s be sure everyone is aware that we are talking client versions here. The servers update far more than the clients do and they don’t always change that number. It’s more appropriate to consider that number the client version (not to be confused with any sort of cache versioning, which I believe is nonquantitative, since they can and do release multiple cache versions per client version).

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape's server game engine
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Taharok:

Lol, why are we talking about memory leaks? Firstly, we have no idea what sort of language they are using serverside (they haven’t disclosed that as far as I remember, though it wouldn’t doubt me if it was Java). Secondly, what does a memory leak have to do with anything in your scope? These are game servers that run for months at a time. They even manage to push updates without completely shutting them down. If they had a memory leak, it would have been found and fixed very quickly, not left to cause potential problems in months ahead. I just dont even know how to reply to this topic lol.

I didn’t bring up memory leaks, nor do i care about them.

mopman_sucks:

cutscenes are not “instanced” thats all client side scripting.

And i was referring to how the server updates the clients while in a cut scene, how other players are not updated of things you perform while in a cut scene, unless that is apart of the scripting.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape's server game engine
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

^ what taharok said. As big as RS is I am sure the occasional leak comes up but they probably look out for them whenever possible.

Read full topic

@amfg wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

It was 204 until they reopened rsc and the latest one is 233.

They probably used the 193 number because Krichevskoy released a client from the RS2 beta that was version 194. The last RSC release before RS2 became the main game was around 196-199 iirc.

My memory is hazy but I’m sure I remember Kaitnieks releasing a 198 RSC deob when RS2 was out.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape's server game engine
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:15, topic:442833”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=545518.msg3999031#msg3999031 date=1337697829]
Lol, why are we talking about memory leaks? Firstly, we have no idea what sort of language they are using serverside (they haven’t disclosed that as far as I remember, though it wouldn’t doubt me if it was Java). Secondly, what does a memory leak have to do with anything in your scope? These are game servers that run for months at a time. They even manage to push updates without completely shutting them down. If they had a memory leak, it would have been found and fixed very quickly, not left to cause potential problems in months ahead. I just dont even know how to reply to this topic lol.
[/quote]
because they think memory leaks are the end all be all problem within rsps. did you say companies are not capable of producing bad software that leads to memory leakage? see: firefox.

edit: how the fuck could one even have memory leakage with in the JVM (assuming there’s no bugs with in the JVM itself). I mean, I suppose not closing a stream could cause a symptom akin to this, but the JVM has a garbage collector…[/quote]

Leaks are possible in Java if your infrastructure is large enough and you don’t properly handle cleaning up old objects. It’s moreover a case of not dereferencing objects that are no longer needed, versus anything else.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape's server game engine
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:18, topic:442833”]^From that blog.

It was developed originally by me and has since been worked on by a few other people at Jagex. It’s a continually evolving language. The RuneScript used by RuneScape these days is totally different to the RuneScript used by RS Classic. It has similarities to various other languages, but is unique.

Someone edit the runescape wiki.

RuneScape Wiki

RuneTek

RuneTek is the game engine used for RuneScape. The latest version, RuneTek 7, was first released as a beta preview on 24 May 2013. Andrew Gower, Mod Chris E and four other Jagex staff have recently finished RuneTek 5. It is unknown what they are...


RuneTek 2 2000–2003* 1-193 RuneScape Classic

Some rs2 kiddies don’t know what they are talking about.[/quote]
that’s correct?

Read full topic

RuneTek

RuneTek is the game engine used for RuneScape. The latest version, RuneTek 7, was first released as a beta preview on 24 May 2013. Andrew Gower, Mod Chris E and four other Jagex staff have recently finished RuneTek 5. It is unknown what they are...

item.title: RuneScape's server game engine
item.dc:creator: @amfg amfg
item.description:
@amfg wrote:

Taharok:

Lol, why are we talking about memory leaks? Firstly, we have no idea what sort of language they are using serverside (they haven’t disclosed that as far as I remember, though it wouldn’t doubt me if it was Java). Secondly, what does a memory leak have to do with anything in your scope? These are game servers that run for months at a time. They even manage to push updates without completely shutting them down. If they had a memory leak, it would have been found and fixed very quickly, not left to cause potential problems in months ahead. I just dont even know how to reply to this topic lol.

RuneScape Wiki

Blog - Q&A: Andrew Gower's Answers

Phox1515 asks: If there was 1 thing you could change without limitations of java, abilities, ECT... any 1 thing with no restrictions at all (like we'll ever have a world like that) what would it be? The one technical limitation I’d most like to be...

Emg Blue asks: What Java platform does RuneScape use? Java EE, Java SE? Or are the servers on EE and clients on SE?

Java SE for both client and server.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

A memory leak tool could only go so far I would imagine. I am not saying that their current version has them. All I am saying is while developing updates I am sure they have to take stuff back to a certain step to get rid of one that may pop up

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape's server game engine
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:11, topic:442833”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=545518.msg3998674#msg3998674 date=1337635455]

Well… we aren’t the only people with memory leaks how about that?

I highly doubt they have memory leaks in their game (at least their servers). Mainly because they are a professional gaming company who are masters at what they do. Second, I know they have their own ‘version’ of a Java Virtual Machine, which is probably optimized to their liking.
[/quote]I’m sure they find leaks occasionally whether or not they make it public knowledge.[/quote]

Jagex knows how to go above and beyond when it comes to handling objects. I doubt a leak has ever existed in their official servers. I wish I kept some of the original documentation on when they were making rs2. They had some unique tools to use.

@Null, can’t be too sure.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape's server game engine
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Taharok:

Can you be less vague about ‘game engine?’ Jagex often uses the term to include both their servers and their client, but mostly they use it to talk about RuneTek. They work very differently (and even oppositely) from each other. Are you trying to document it from the perspective of the player or the game world?

You’re right, I am not that clear of a writer I’m referring to the game world.

Read full topic
